0570/A0/04/002/001.status_value: No centralized system  the development of such a system is envisaged in several strategic documents on national level.  The Agency for Social Assistance is still completing a project on developing and maintaining an information system  including on child protection  which will enable the disaggreration of data. The Ministry of Interior is completing a project on a system for comprehensive collection of data on children victims of crime and children offenders.
0570/A0/04/002/001.indicator_name: Availability of a centralized system for comprehensive collection of data on the rights of children with a specific emphasis on vulnerable groups  including girls and boys from marginalized ethnic minorities and children with disabilities
0570/A0/04/002/001.headline: The capacity of the Ombudsman for child rights monitoring and promotion strengthened  a SitAn developed  the situation of refugee and migrant children monitored and the capacity of the civil society organizations enhanced to protect and promote children&#39 s rights.
0570/A0/04/002/001.baseline_value: No centralized system on child data (2012)

0570/A0/04/002/001.indicator_name: Analysis of the country's readiness for signing the Optional Protocol  to the Convention on the Rights of the Child on a communications procedure (OPIC)
0570/A0/04/002/001.headline: The capacity of the Ombudsman for child rights monitoring and promotion strengthened  a SitAn developed  the situation of refugee and migrant children monitored and the capacity of the civil society organizations enhanced to protect and promote children&#39 s rights.

0570/A0/03/001/006.status_value: Minimum package of social services was not officialy defined by government. 128 municipalities provide alternative community based social services for children and families (50 % of municipalities
0570/A0/03/001/006.indicator_name: Municipalities provide community based alternative social services in accordance with the adopted minimum package of social services

0570/A0/03/001/005.status_value: Draft Child Act is developed and submitted to praliament  New Child Friendly Justice concept was approved by Council of Ministers in 2011.
0570/A0/03/001/005.baseline_value: 3 main legislative acts (Child Protection Act  The Juvenile Delinquency Act  Family Code) require changes to better support child's rights implementation

0570/A0/03/001/004.status_value: Programme budgeting not fully functional and does not allow to asses budgets for child programes separately.
0570/A0/03/001/004.indicator_name: % of targeted budget allocations in support of inter-sectoral child related programmes
0570/A0/03/001/004.baseline_value: No cross-sectoral budgets for child related programmes

0570/A0/03/002/004.status_value: 5 major events  widely covered by media were organised in 2012
0570/A0/03/002/004.indicator_name: # of major media events promoting child's rights and child related programmes and policies through UNICEF

0570/A0/03/002/004.status_value: Several child participation events supported. National Child Council  Child Friendly Municipality  Child consultation  local event in Rousse  etc. New mechanism for child participation in schools developed and demonstration testing commenced in 14 schools in 2012

0570/A0/03/002/003.status_value: 20 corporate  donors supporting UNICEF activities in Bulgaria  more than 50 media outlets  62 000 Facebook fans   4000 pledge donors (individuals)  30 high profile individuals supporting UNICEF programmes
0570/A0/03/002/003.indicator_name: % of partnerships with private sector  media and individuals supporting child related issues through UNICEF
0570/A0/03/002/003.baseline_value: 17 % of private sector recognize UNICEF as an organization to be supported for the implementation of child related programmes
